review: Red Robin is absolutely amazzzing! I never get tired of this place. Their bottomless steak fries alone hits the jack pot, but now their burgers on the other hand are out of this ball park! The most flavored burger I've tasted than any other restaurant. As good as this place is not all their food on the menu is tasting. The chicken burger wasn't what we expected a little dry so my husband took it back and exchanged it for a burger. Other than that the rest of the food was great.  The only thing I do have to add is it's very affordable, but their strawberry lemonade is quite pricy. It's almost $4.00!

As far as burger joints in Visalia go, this is probably as popular as in n out. Never a dull time at this place! I usually opt for the classic fav, the clucks and fries, but I decided to live a little and got the Taco Tavern double. Man o man I was not let down! It tastes just like a GOOD taco truck taco in a burger. And of course the bottomless fries are a plus. I also got this new drink that is called Titos cream soda. It's Tito's vodka and your choice or orange or raspberry cream soda. Trinity, our waitress, makes the best ones! She was also great with asking if we needed more fries or another round of those delicious cream sodas! My hubby always gets the clucks and fries and he's rated them the best in town in his book. Plus if you sign up for their rewards program, every 10th burger or entree is free.

My pervious review of Red Robin being a mediocre chain restaurant is no longer the case. My husband is a big lover of their burgers so after a full morning of shopping, I let him have his way and we came in here for lunch. Let me just say that the remodel isn't the only improvements recently made here. Our server was on top of his game. Fast, friendly and efficent. We never waited for refills, or our check. I decided to try the ghost pepper tavern burger. My burger was out of this world delicious! Perfectly cooked, seasoned and very spicy as I'd hoped. The fries were so fresh! Piping hot and damn good. I don't remember the name of the burger that my husband ordered but he was also happy as a clam with his meal. Prices are great, seating is cozy and comfortable, and the service was stellar. Looking forward to coming back again sometime.

Red Robin is always strong - particularly in value. The quality of he food is good- but the value is great. Unlimited fries is a always a nice touch. Ample TVs and a friendly family atmosphere. This one on Visalia is frequently packed- today I got right in which was nice. I had the A1 perper corn burger which was decent. No complaints.

I truly have a love hate relationship with this place It was once upon a time the best place to get a restaurant burger but that was yeeeeeaaaaaarrrrsss ago like the 90's. Especially this location. So cool to be opened up on one side to the mall you can watch passers by and if you're passing by peer into the restaurant. You see Over the years the portions have just gotten too small. So small in fact I cringe at the sentence "let's go to Red Robin" .  I don't enjoy my dining experiences here anymore at any location. Our service was Good and the ambiance is toned down and chill so yeah it is what it is

I came in tonight with a party of 9, we were greeted with a great attitude by our server Stevie. He got us drinks, and complementary fries right away. As appetizers we got the onion rings which were crispy and delicious. For meals most of us did the sir acha tavern double which was delicious as well. We devoured it so rapidly we became full so quick. Stevie did a great job on keeping an eye on refilling and offering more drinks. The bottomless French fries kept coming as well, my family and I definitely enjoyed our experience there. Overall food was really good and having Stevie as our server made our experience 10xx better. I would say it is better than our Chino Hills location. Next time when we come up for vacation, we will be requesting Stevie as our server my family enjoyed him serving us.

Soooo...I came here for a friends bday party on Sat and it was super busy..totally understandable, but not my food!! We waited 45 min for our food to come out and my meal was sooo gross. Looks nice in the picture, but trust me I almost puked. The lettuce was wilted, I had bottom ends of tomatoes,  and the meat was rubbery!! yuck!! I would appreciate next time I have to wait 45 min, that my food taste amazing!! Fries were good, and my waiter was very nice..

I have lived here in Visalia since birth and I have always had A great experience while dining at this location.  Tonight we had a party of 12 and a few complicated orders. Our waiter was enthusiastic, funny, and very polite. His name is Michael and he told us he has only been working here 2 Weeks. This guy needs a New Years Bonus if you ask me for putting up with the crowd we had in the party room.

This was by far the worse Red Robin ever. It's very confusing when you walk in. The menus are missing items. I even asked for another one and it also was missing stuff. The food was not typical of what I have had at other Red Robin's. The places has more seats then it can handle. The waitress didn't even listen to the order on the drinks. What more can I say not a good representation of other Red Robin's!

My Order # 72744656 and I placed it tonight. I want to say what a exceptional service I had from the bartender when I picked up my order. She had short blonde hair.  From the moment I walked in she went and checked on it and told me it would be a few. She went to check on one of her tables and then went back and brought me out a cup full of fries for my ride home and then minutes later came out with my order. She verified everything was cooked and made to order and even brought out sides of ranch even though I hadn't asked for them yet. I have to say it was my best experience ever anywhere. She was quick and prompt especially being that was almost 100 degrees out!! I will gladly continue to come to this location!!

I was up in Visalia to meet with my daughter. We decided to meet at Red Robin. We asked for a booth and sat down at a nice clean table. After a few minutes our server came by and took our drink orders and showed us how to order right from the table. We ordered our lunch and after a short wait we had our food.  The food here is great and the fry's are really good to!! Our burgers were made just as we had asked. The server took our order and the food was just right!!   This has to be one of the best burgers out there!!! You get quality and freshness here for sure!!! Even the little extras like additional BBQ sauce was delivered with a smile...  This place has the best staff and customer service by far. I would recommend this place to everyone that wants great food and great service!! They provide the best!! Hats off to Red Robin!!  The place was real clean. the parking was easy when we got there. Easy in and out...

The food was good. The service was great. The parking at this restaurant is horrible. It is in the middle of a mall. So you are competing with Macy's and such.   I don't see the attraction to this place but the wife enjoys it. The men's bathroom is consistently dirty.   I ate here again on Thursday 06/22/2017. The burgers were cold and the salad was warm. I can't figure out why I keep going to this restaurant so many other places to spend my money.

The food is always good when I go. Always a packed place so if your not big on ppl....I would suggest somewhere else but there's a variety of food to choose from. So that's a plus. The waiters/waitresses are pretty attentive.

This has got to be the best "big party" restaurant service I have EVER had!!! In a large party, typically the servers have a hard time keeping up with the many demands or it's hard to get everything correct. Our server was so attentive, and with so many demands, kept up with our many requests the whole time and with a smile! I would definitely come back to this RR!!

Its usually a while before your acknowledged and seated. The hostess is never at the stand. The bartenders and servers in the bar area are more attentive and check on you frequently. I don't come here often but the food has always been good. A nice place to have a burger and catch a game.

The food is always great! My family and I love eating here, however this locations is just dirty, the booth we were sitting in was sticky and the walls were dirty. We definitely won't be comming back.

The waiter brought the people sitting beside us their drinks first even tho me and my family had ordered long before them, the waiter offered refills on drinks and fries when we had asked for the check already, the burger was soaked and bun was soggy upon receiving it. This was a very bad and uncomfortable experience. For the price of their burgers we expected A LOT and they failed to deliver! NEVER AGAIN.
Terrible service. Took FOREVER for the food to come out. And the fruit and veggies are rotten. Won't ever come back here!!
Bad service, food was cold and waiter ignored us when I asked for more fries... I want to say he was bothered I even asked because he made sure to get some for the other tables and not us.

Great food! The spinach and artichoke dip - is DELICIOUS! Happy hour is very chill here. Unfortunately,  I couldn't give a higher rating, due to their selection of beers (for happy hour pricing). Out of the 10 beers on tap, only 2 were on happy hour pricing, which was a huge disappointment. As for appetizers on happy hour, the selection was minimal as well, only 3 options. Hopefully management can "change happy hour selections to drive future business".   The 4th star is purely for our server. He was great. Without him, this rating would have been a "3".
Red Robin has improved a bit. Good food. Nothing out of the ordinary. It's the place to go when you can't decide where to go and it has something for everyone.  I like the chicken Caesar salad.
Excellent food. Waitress was the only one in the bar area so it was a little slow. Got a free milkshake with my rewards card.

My girlfriend almost committed the act of cannibalism on my right forearm as we awaited the never ending struggle of waiting for food. Don't get me wrong, waiting is one thing, but my beard grew a few more inches waiting for drink orders. When we walked outside after the arduous journey of starvation I looked out upon the barren wasteland that is the valley and thought to myself "what year is it?" *insert Robin Williams facial expressions* I then got in my car and began to cry in Spanish.
AMY!!! AMY!!! AMY!!!  She is a rockstar!!!!!!!!!! Awesome service as always(:  Today a mishap popped up that wasn't here fault and like handled it like a boss. Love that girll

Service was good. Environment in the bar area, the servers bumped into my chair at least 8 times within 60 min. Ridiculous layout, tables are too close. I could here the couples conversation next to me. Nothing special about the food, Western bbq whiskey burger & 10 fries. Will not return or recommend. 2 stars for the server.

The portions have gotten smaller and smaller, and the quality of the food has gone down over the years. Before they remodeled, the food and service was great. But now, the quality is more like a fast food burger and fries.

Victor if you ever read this. Thank you for your service here on our multiple trips here. You certainly go through a lot with shitty inconsiderate customers and I'm sorry you have to go through that. Working in customer service I feel for you brother! Will keep tipping big for you!  Now on to the review. The four is because the wife and I haven't given up on R.R. Yet. When you choose the right thing you have the most amazing meal! Who would've known you can get so much joy for your tummy when eating a burger lol. But when you don't choose the right thing your stuck being unfulfilled and your tummy hates you cause you're still hungry! I love that they do bottomless fries and beverages "certain beverages mainly your main sodas plus now root beer floats", yum! Oh also Lemonade. I had the Southern Charm burger last time we came here a few days ago. It was good but wasn't great. Spent 14 dollars on the burger and I could've gotten a better one for a few dollars less; bigger too. But overall it was good, would definitely would try something else instead of this one. You can get a better one of these at Carl's JR lol it's the same burger just bigger and on a different bun. Customer Service Advice- don't be an ass to your server. Unless they're rude or deserve it, don't do it! If you just placed your order then turn around and ask him five minutes later "where's my burger at? Everyone else is getting theirs!?" First off.. this was an old lady doing this so "I get it" but still it was not cool and very disrespectful to the server. She didn't know we were waiting for 10 minutes before they even showed up to get our food and the other couples that came before her as well. Victor held is own and stayed cool about it. The 2nd incident- the couple behind us barely sits down and right after dealing with The bitty our server asks them "hi folks what can I get you started with today?" The guys first response is "we'd like to get some drinks first!" In the most condescending asshole voice ever! Again without missing a beat Victor overcame and took their drink order. This was a poor excuse from people in general. Learn to be a little nicer.
Service is friendly enough. Food comes as ordered even if I make changes (which I always do at Red Robin). I'm never dissapointed by the flavor.

I literally just went here as soon as they opened and the old blonde super dark tan waitress did not acknowledge us, did not give us a menu, did not come over to our table Au all.  We sat there twiddling our thumbs until we finally just left. Absolute trash. The whole place was empty and she couldn't even service one table. Pathetic

Red Robin used to be the place to go to get a good burger and fries. Sadly, service is lacking in both food, cleanliness and customer service. The floor is covered in smashed fried zucchini and crayons. The bench has crumbs all over it....and the food - I could have gotten a better meal at Carl's Junior and paid less. Also, the worst part was the waitress who delivered our food, used our tray to move the debit machine on the table rubbing our meal all over it! I mean this is just such a disgusting disappointment. Never coming back.

Sad!  We walk in about 1 o'clock on a Monday.  I use the restroom and greeted by the stench, all three trash cans are full and over flowing...I would have to say that it rated with some of the worst truck stop bathrooms I have ever seen.  As I headed to my table multiple tables are dirty and full of dishes. The bright points the waitress was good, but had too many tables, the food was OK.  The amazing part when my husband says something to the hostess about the bathroom she says, "Oh it gets that way".  WHAT!?!.  Won't be back.
So after my bad experience at hometown buffet, I decided to check out RED ROBIN and I loved it !  great service and great food ! 10/10 would come again !
Our first time here and we loved it.  Servers were very informative and friendly. We will definitely be back again.

I've been to this Red Robin at least 12 times in the past year with my family. The service is horrible..... the servers are always rushed. I've experienced wrong orders and while awaiting the addition to whatever was forgotten the rest of the food is cold. We usually go with a party of at least 10. I gave 2 stars for the one employee that tend to do an awesome job at serving us when we frequent Red Robin....thats Jess! She works at  the bar but occasionally helps out with serving. This last trip we had it! It was my 3 year olds birthday and we all went to dinner. Food was either cold or burnt and the server, Tonya, told us that she could not bring out fries because they had limited what she could bring to the table. We were not given the birthday meal for my daughter or the sundae..... it was at this point I decided that I will not return!

I am not sure if it's the pokey stop that makes this place busy! Or there's just a little bit understaffing going on here!!! But the service we received was pretty good and the food wasn't too bad.. I don't know if I recommend this to my friends or family or that I will be back anytime soon... They do live up to their 2 1/2 star rating!!

The food was great but as my luck would have it, the system went down and my order was lost. After 30 minutes it was found though and the manager discounted my ticket. One complaint I do have is when you push the button to get a server the light that flashes seems to be ignored.
Horrible service, If you are looking for a restaurant that loves to play games and could care less if you liked the food or not.... this is the place for you :)

I had the WORST experience here this evening. We got seated at a booth table, the seat still had food and grease from previous people. I asked our waiter if he could wipe it down, he said "Or you can lick it". After that rude comment we got up and left. We will not be going back. So disrespectful to say such a thing!

Maybe I came to early, it was before noon. The burger was just as I ordered it, but the fries were cold and I am seriously wondering if they were from the night before. Waitress did not come around for me to ask for fresh fries, or a refill on my soda. Bummer.

I had a great experience, my server Alvaro was fantastic, never needed to ask twice or wait! Food was hot fresh and very affordable! I will be back soon. Even got free garlic fries! No reason only because I was curious about the price.

My sister was visiting from France, with her passport (only form of ID). Decided to take her there to get a burger and a beer. Was denied alcohol service despite being 27yo.....they said they don't accept foreign passport. Didn't even ordered anything, left and would never go back

I have been to RR several times.  I usually really enjoy it. But on 9/9/14 a group of 5 of us went to celebrate a birthday. The hostess was terrible. She sat us at a dirty table but we moved to a not so dirty table. Then she sat another group at a dirty booth and they complained so she moved them to our first dirty without cleaning it.  Then she sat three girls at the dirty booth without cleaning it. Our service was so bad. The table next to us was seated at least 15 min after us and was served right away.  Once we received our appetizers we had to ask for utensils, duh.   The best part is when we were given a bill for $45 and some change and I knew that couldn't be correct. We had several cocktails. She says "O let me check", then brings me a bill for $140.  No brains. I could have just paid the $45 and left. I would NEVER recommend that RR.

I WILL NEVER, EVER, EVER GO TO RED ROBIN AGAIN !!! I have tried giving them chance after chance after chance to get better. Either the service is horrible, the food is cold, the host/hostess is rude or it takes forever to get your food. Had Dinner with my Nephew, his wife and their daughter last night and it was horrible. First we had to wait to be seated, no one was there. Then our food took over an hour to get. Then the Manager we complained to said "It always takes at least an hour to get our food out", but then told us she was upset when she learned we had complained about how long it took, and went back in the kitchen to see what the problem was. Then didn't even offer to take anything off or bill, I had to ask for it. NEVER, EVER AGAIN !!!!! They will be getting a bad review from me with corporate office as well as Yelp. Save yourself the money and time....Go elsewhere !!!!   I dislike this place, their food and their staff.   Management sucks !!!!!!  P.S.  Only ordered a bacon cheesburger for my mother and i to share and two ice tea's.......$18 bill.   Really, $6.00 for flavored water ????

First time at a Red Robin as the SB location se fue ages ago and my FB friends were right: it's a very good burger! I loved my cole slaw, so much so I am thinking we should hit RR and bring home a pint or something for me to eat on the way home.  I read the other reviews so was prepared for terrible service but our server was outstanding. Not good but great. When we walked in, it wasn't that crowded but the host told us we might want to sit in the bar because there were a ton of kids in the main dining area.  An excellent--and insightful--suggestion as I had a horrible hormone headache and I like other people's kids in public places but in moderate quantities. I have no desire for a Chuck E Cheese experience, at least if it is half as bad as my parent friends who pretty much associate with all that is evil about public places or children.  Our server doubles as bartender and still, he was efficient and friendly running his a** between the two jobs. He struck me as smarter than the average kid in college working at a casual eatery to make some extra money and I would not be surprised if he intends to get out of Visalia ASAP and go to a metropolitan area to do something interesting and fun with his life.  (We went to Foster's Freeze after dinner and while the sundae was perfect--just what I wanted--my stomach turned both at the smell and the sadness both of employees and customers. Those kids broke my heart, seeming destined for very little else by Foster's Freeze on Mooney Blvd. The sad vibe and smell made my boyfriend and me eat on the little stone edge outside before hopping back in the car to the Marriott.)  J ordered a bacon burger and the steak fries with the Thai dipping sauce. I thought the sauce was weird but he enjoyed it. My cheeseburger was great and as I was sick, I didn't drink alcohol so the tab for two including tip was only 26. Pretty great for the quality of the food.  (They do have a wide range of specialty cocktails in the 8 dollar range: big fruity tropical things. They also have "beer shakes"--a combination of beer, whiskey and ice cream. Too weird for me but I thought I'd mention it)

The new remodel is nice! However the bar is so crowded with high top tables that the servers literally have to ask customers to stand up and move so they can get their trays of food through the isles.  Went there last night for dinner and i had to squeeze in my seat and I'm a thin person.   My husband 6'4" was asked to get up at least 4 times for the servers to get by. I feel like we were all on top of each other with no privacy for conversion.  I felt bad for the servers. Food and service was great as always. Next time if it is busy we will go elsewhere just because of the seating.
Burgers are good. Vanilla shakes are terrible! The shake was like basically whipped cream in a cup.

2 waitresses watched us walk in, we weren't greeted or seated by either. It seemed awkward, almost as if they were dodging us. It was a slow day with only a handful of patrons. We seated ourselves anyway and waited 10 minutes, and were never even greeted or given a menu. We walked out, and will never be back.
I absolutely love red robin. The food is always great but, its hard to enjoy good food with horrible service.

sitting at the bar on a friday night and drink is been empty for 15 minutes. not because he is ignoring but because of poor management!!!! how are you going to have one bartender on a friday night with football on the tv, a full bar(full bar), taking to go orders, and trying to fill the main floor drinks.....wth managers....really i see you walking around both male and female managers. to top it off i hear you staff complaining about your poor skills in staffing and supplies!!!! p.s. managers my drink is still empty now 20 minutes but i'm not complaining because it's not the bartenders fault.....it's yours management.....thanks for keeping me drunk on my birthday!!!!

I will NEVER eat here (or any RR establishment) again. The food and service here is consistently horrible, and this evening a waitress rudely "mouthed-off" to my 79-year-old father. COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE!!! The only thing the manager did was remove a salad we'd erroneously been charged for from our bill, and take $8 off our $75 bill!!! I plan to tell friends, family, anyone who'll listen - DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME HERE!!!

Come Here to drink then if you must you can eat,that will make meal much more enjoyable!! I came back after hearing a new pepper burger was good from from a friend. And it was a good burger not great but good but my fries were dead cold and wrong so I received a second bunch of fries this time garlic like I ordered and they were warm but nasty no fresh garlic just garlic salt or powder. Very disappointing, I would recommend another place for a burger or come and have a drink nice enough place and staff
Always a great place for good food and drinks. And the customer service is always on point, love coming here when we're in the neighborhood.

I went here for lunch with my boyfriend, brother, and sister in law Sunday afternoon and we experienced the worst service ever! There was NO host in the front and there were several people waiting to be seated. We sat in the bar area and our waiter provided HORRIBLE customer service as well. He NEVER checked on us to see if we needed anything or had any questions. He only came to the table to provide us with our drinks and food. I tried to get his attention several times and he avoided eye contact every time. Our food took FOREVER to get to the table and when we did get it, my brother found little hairs in his chicken wings and my bread had Mold on it! Worst experience we've ever had at Red Robin. Their customer service is HORRIBLE!

Was finally seated and sat down on what I thought was a cushioned booth seat only to find out there was a huge hole in the booth bench where the inner padding must have worn down. Hurt and shocked by this I kinda yelped out ow! And the hostess said oh yeah we get complaints about that all the time. Really?! As my husband sat down he also felt the hard bench seat as well. We finally just got up and left when no one came to take our order. #UPDATE.

Stopes in here for lunch, not happy at all. The food was ok, came out fast. The waitress was Mia most of the time. Best part of the experience was the camp fire sauce. Got the prime rib dip, got only minimal grilled onions very disappointed.

If you've been to Red Robin before, you should know what to expect..in terms of their food.  Their burgers are always good and they have free substitutes (eg, gluten-free bread, kaiser rolls, ciabatta, etc and salad instead of fries, etc).   I came on a Sunday night when it wasn't so busy.  However, the servers did seem too busy to attend to my table.  A guy introduced himself when we were first seated, and then he disappeared without saying anything - didn't even get us drinks.  Then a girl came over to take our order and would forget what we asked for.  As previous reviews suggest, they could use some more customer service training. Minus one star for bad service. They have a new rewards program where you can get a free birthday meal and $20 off your 6th visit (after visiting 5 times within the first 5 weeks).  They'll probably just give you a card - you don't have to ask for it.
The burgers are decent and the bottomless fries will have to be requested again and again if you want your fill as they bring them out a handful at a time.

Had to try out Red Robins burger especially after their new renovations on the resturant.  I LOVE THE NEW DECOR. ITS RED, CHIC AND MODERN! first of all if you never carry cash they have these portable pay machines at each table so forget waiting at the counter to pay at the register, you can swipe and tip easily. My experience was great, my waiter was awesome. Didnt catch his name but he was great. Even offered a drink to go when I asked for a take home box. My Burger was awesome, endless fries. Red Robins is awesome!

Service at this specific location is always terrible for us for some reason. I have gone to this one multiple times and they are always a letdown which is a shame because I love Red Robin and would rather go shopping in Visalia rather than Fresno.

I've been to this restaurant many times throughout the years. They recently remodeled the atmosphere of the restaurant and in my opinion it looks better than ever! The environment is family friendly. Of, course the burgers are delicious and there are many to choose from. The only complaint I have is that I haven't seen the red robin mascot in awhile.

I like the new look and all but man have they've gotten sloppy with their food! Service was ok but to ask us to rate them high on the survey to get more hours was unprofessional. Anyways these are the very bad onion rings we were served.

There was a live bug in my friend's salad! My lunch had some of the same ingredients as the salad and I was disgusted and couldn't eat anymore. While she was not charged for her salad I was charged for my lunch containing the same lettuce etc. High prices for food I ate less than half of.

Wow! I am shocked to say that my husband can't get a beer on his 30th bday with his license that expired today, EVEN THOUGH he has the temporary license from the dmv with all the information on his license. The manager herself would not ok this. I'm shocked and disgusted that this is the place we chose to eat on his birthday so he can get a beer too. Wow!!! Not coming back here for a long time!
This was the worst burger ever!! Over priced and cold, they don't toast the buns. I could go on and on but if I were you I wouldn't waste your time or money.

The food is good. That's why we keep coming back. However over time their portions have really gotten smaller, but yet their prices got a little higher. Service varies here. Can either be good, but other times, takes really long. And their greeter today?! Wow. Hickies, tattoos, and lip piercings.. Definition of ghetto!

The wife and I come here when we want a good burger and margarita. This location of Red Robin is usually pretty good.  I had the Red Robin Royale. As usual it was great and more than enough food.  As much as I enjoyed the food I didn't care for the seating. We were seated close to the door. The chose for some reason to keep the front doors open and allowing the bugs to come in.  Also waiting customers were so close to us while we were trying to eat. I guess it couldn't be helped. It is Friday night and this place get crowded. Good thing we got here early. I'm only giving 3 stars cz it is a chain restaurant. So what more can u expect.
Bad service !!!!!! Food is good but everyone working here could use a lesson in customer service ...... not friendly at all just dropped a menu on my crossed arms and walked away

We thought we would give this place another shot but eh, once again I'm less than impressed. The only reason I gave 3 stars was because of our waitress, otherwise it would have been 1 star. It's not as good as it used to be.  I used to love hown unique Red Robin was but now it's just another chain along the lines of a Chili's or Applebees.

Good burger and service.  Fries are below average. Prices are OUTRAGEOUS! Met at this location for a small birthday get together with 5 friends.  I ordered the Black and Blue burger.  Didn't even look at the price.  It's a burger place, how much can it cost?  Asked for the garlic fries option for a buck more. Water to drink. Food came out pretty quickly.  Burger was very tasty.  Fries were just OK.  Garlic fries means they sprinkle garlic salt on them with a little parmesan cheese?  Nothing I'd ever get again.   Our server was very good and timely.  The manager even stopped by all the tables to check on how our experience was.  I said it was great.  I hadn't seen the bill yet. Most of us paid on the little computer check out screen on the table.  My meal of good burger, so so fries and water ... $16.65!  With tip it was $20 out the door. $20 bucks for a burger and water in Visalia?  Very disappointed in the value.  Will not be back. In-N-Out is right across the street.  Save your money and eat there before you hit the mall.

Came here during lunch hour today and after more than 15 minutes of just sitting there trying to get the waitress attention we walked out. I would completely understand if the place was packed, but that wasn't the case at all. I refuse to come back after this has been my favorite restaurant in Visalia for years.

Pretty good place to grab a burger or a beer! Love the royal robin burger, I'm a huge fan of an egg in my burger. The fries are probably my favorite in town! Also must try the chocolate shakes (monster size if you dare). The black and blue burger is superb, and I highly recommend the fried cod and chips. Yummmmmm

Generally we love red robin, but tonight was a perfect storm!  Lots of things went wrong for our party of 12 including not receiving just our kids food until after being seated for an hour!  Once most of us received our food, three orders were incorrect or missing items and a fourth they had to reorder because it was missing completely, but wait staff didn't even figure it out due to not checking on us or brings things that we needed or were missing for unreasonable amounts of delays. We finally took our complaints to management who were of little help and NEVER followed up with us! There are more errors to be told but suffice it to say, if you don't mind waiting for an hour for a typically decent burger and are okay with your order being wrong a first, second or third time and enjoy your wait staff not being attentive to your needs, you'll be fine.
For frozen and reheated food this is about as good as it gets.  The remodel and interior update was much needed.  Prices are still reasonable.  One of the better kids meals menus

The wife had a random craving for RR so we stopped by here to visit.  We were sat very quickly and our waitress, Yolanda approached us and took our drink order within a few minutes.  We both ordered cluck plates. I ordered the clucks and shrimp and my wife was feeling like just chicken and fries. Food was spot on. The food was as expected for where we are. Great unhealthy food! While we were eating, the manager was taking an active role making sure that everyone's experience was to their liking.  Yolanda was very attentive to all of her tables and was very personable.  All together, this experience was top notch for me.

Service was beyond horrible!! Mona the manager was horrible as well!! We brought to her attention that the service was horrible and we got our food in shifts.. The server did not bring us settings to eat with. We had to get up & go to a side station to get our own silverware! It too us 20 min to pay after we were done eating. I would never go back to this location again! Nor should anyone else, especially if your going to celebrate a graduation or something special for a loved one.

Crackers.   I want crackers.  In my salad, in my soup, heck! ...maybe I just want to eat them with everything.  No need to worry, that definitely won't be happening at Red Robin: The only so called "restaurant" not even carrying them, let alone serving them.    Madness I tell you.    It's the icing on the cake of "See you later, there are way to many restaurants around," after watching their service decline recently.   We are going from 2-3 times a month to no more.

Service was horrible. Went to watch the playoff game and got nothing but attitude from the bar staff. Place had a lot of empty spaces. Staff seamed preoccupied and not willing to please the customer. Our party left in middle of the game to go to another restaurant. Red Robin in Visalia is ran by Bumms  Never going back

I love the burgers, but the place is dirty! Dead flies stuck in the blinds and dustballs on the window sills in the bar. The lunch waitresses are pretty annoying, watching video's on their phones behind the bar...and really loud talkers! Takes a long time to get the food too. I try to look past these things, but cleanliness always leaves me wondering what the kitchen looks like!

Had great service. Our waiter Eddie was very attentive, nice,  and polite. We ordered quickly, our food got to us quickly, and we were out the door! With Red Robin restaurants, you don't know if it's going to be disgustingly dirty or clean. This one wasn't the best one we've been to, but it was pretty good. The hamburgers were good and as always the endless steak fries were yummy! The only negative was we were seated in the bar area. It was crowded and loud. I don't care for that type of atmosphere. And, my husband reminded me that it was freezing cold in there!

Visalia Favorite since it opened decades ago.  You don't come here for the salads, so don't order it. Always good burger, very consistent. BEST BURGERS IN VISALIA! There a few other burger spots: Five Guys, The Habit, In N Out, Checkers, and Glicks. Glicks is the worst burger in Visalia, don't go there.

I love this place. The service could improve upon but the food is great. A little pricey as expected. I love their whiskey river wraps. They are amazing. Service is pretty speedy though. You don't wait long after ordering for your food. At least, that is what I've experience on my several visits there.

We were seated within two minutes of arriving, even though we had no reservation. That part was great, but then we spent over 15 minutes waiting for a server to come to our table to take our drink and appetizer orders. The drinks were brought over quickly and some of us even ordered monster milkshakes. I swear that every time I visit Red Robin the milkshake serving is shrinking, but that might just all be in my head. The meals came out in around 20 or so minutes and our table had all the condiments and shakers stocked and ready to be used. Our server was prompt with providing drink refills and removing empty plates. When it came time to pay our bill the server was no where to be found. Once we finally did flag him over it took unnecessarily long to process all our separate checks. Every table has a tablet with a printer built in so that you may place food and drink orders, and also pay your bills. I don't like this method of taking payment. Our tablet's printer jammed and gave out garbled messes for receipts.

I like their food, and the rewards program. However, every time I go, we get seated in the bar area despite the entire restaurant being open. And it doesnt matter how many guests I have in my party. I have been there w/ just myself and my husband and we get the bar. I have been there w/ 4 plus people and get the bar area. I am 6mo pregnant, so I dont know why they would think that I want to be in the bar area. We have even been asked to sit in the regular section, and they act like 'how dare you'

Awesome tasting lunch.  Pretzel bites to start. Whiskey river BBQ burger with seasoned fries was great. Food came out tasting fresh, fries were hot. David L. In the bar always brings his "A" game when serving. Very attentive, and friendly. Make sure to ask for him when you drop in. It makes the experience worth it.

I love eating here and the food is just great, but the last time I ate here I don't know what the heck was going on. I ordered a grilled chicken salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing on the side. When they brought out my salad they gave me ranch dressing instead. Yuck. When I began to eat I realized they gave me NO FORK. How the hell am I supposed to eat the salad then? Come on guys! I love this restaurant but my order was not in any way difficult. Trust me though, I've had better experiences in the past. This last one I hope was just a fluke. Therefore, I'm leaving it at 3 stars.
I was very sprites how delicious the crispy chicken sandwich was, I would definitely come back just for the sandwhich. Fries are good too.

Oh boy! Nice people. Really nice people. Really not good food.  I love Red Robin! I'm a long time fan of the chain. I've visited numerous locations and it has been consistent.  Don't misunderstand, this isn't gastronomy. It's burgers, fries and the like, but it's generally good. They're generous with the fried items and lemonade, etc. sometimes, that's what you want. No need to go highbrow or gastropub all the time. Still, wtf? Really not good. Chicken burger was cold in the center and not fully cooked. Broccoli was microwaved to destruction. Apple was past it's prime.  If a kid leaves Mac n' Cheese with a turned up nose and dismissive wave of the hand, something is terribly wrong. Throw in foul restrooms and I must sadly say, "No, no, no."

I came in here to get my standard A-1 peppercorn burger with garlic fries and the first thing that hit me was the stench of an old bar towel.  I mentioned my observation to the bar tender and his response was "it's just this bar". My immediate thought was then it needs to be cleaned better! I decide my favorite burger and garlic fries (with extra garlic) are worth putting up with the smell, only to find out they've replaced their garlic fries with a garlic seasoning and no longer use the minced garlic.  I canceled my food order and finished my beer... now to find the manager and share with them my Yelp review before I leave.  Two stars for this visit Red Robin, two stars.....

This location is extremely busy and severely under staffed for the amount of customers they attempt to serve. It took 25 minutes for our food to arrive. I'm glad I had exact change as it probably would have taken a half hour to see our waitress again.
Could not give us service due to lack of servers. Place was pretty dead so im not sure how there was not enough servers.
I only came here because I had a gift card. Service is always slow, no matter the day/time. The only thing we got fast was, the check.

We were told that we would have half an hour to wait and over an hour has past and we're still being ignored. The hostess is hardly paying attention to anyone and when we pointed out open tables she said we've been assigned to a particular table and have to wait for it as the people there are just visiting. She doesn't care. Horrible service.

Came in to eat after having a long day, and when I got there, we weren't even greeted. My co worker and I Waited 5 minutes to be seated and there were many tables available including the bar area too!  Once we were finally seated our server asked what drinks we liked and then after receiving our drinks, we had to wait at least 10 minutes for someone to actually take our order. Once we were done taking our order, we asked for a side of fries while we were waiting.... The waiter told us they don't do bottomless fries anymore..... But you're menu states it does. Anyways he then asked, "I can charge you $1.99 for side of fries"  I replied "I guess!" Being irritated that I had to pay for my bottomless fries made me upset! After about 15-20 minutes waiting for our food, I never got my side of fries I had asked for. Our food was not even hot. It wasn't even a good warm! The experience was horrible! Then the waiter gave us our check and still never received my side of Fries, I was still getting charged it! I asked the waiter to take it off and he did, but my overall service was horrible! You say you don't serve bottomless fries when you advertise that you do! My food was not hot, waited too long and never got everything I had ordered! Felt like we were forgotten!  Makes me think that maybe next time we should go to Applebee's instead!
Horrible if you come in on a Friday night. We waited almost 1 hour to get our food. It's like they don't know how to handle a lot of people or need more staff.

The service was amazing. The young man was so polite and always had a smile on his face. His section was packed and yet he was always available. We usually don't come here because we've never really cared for the service before but this time changed our minds. We will come back again and ask for Bryce's section.

Sucks!!! They overcharged us 25 dollars, by switching other table bill, after that they promised to deposit money to our account, empty promises of freaking managers! Mona Lisa  I tipped these freeloaders 10$. Fantastic rip off!!!

Horrible horrible.  We showed up around 9pm and the place was almost empty.  No one was dining there yet we still waited around a while to be greeted.  Once greeted we were told there was a wait because there went enough waiters to help us.  Couldn't you sit us down and hand us menus so we could at least start relaxing?  We saw A LOT of empty tables.  We decided to leave and head to another restaurant.  Will definitely not be back.
This place is hit or miss. Sometimes the food is awesome and service is horrible. Other times the food is awesome then you get food poisoning and the service was awesome.

It's been a couple of years since I've tried it.  Never a fan but came because of a large gathering.  The menu has narrowed to essentially expendive burgers and a smattering of sandwiches.  I ordered the cod fish n chips.  The batter is tender crunchy light in taste.  The fish is fluffy and quite flaky juicy.  Hoeever the fish sauce is bland with nary any tangy flavor that I normally expect.  The fries is quite robust and thick cut.  Sadly any kind of vegetable side fixing is missing.  For $ 12, a side of cole slaw would be nice. A four star for dish but two stars for a very pricy sandwich menu. Overall, it's a three.  It's not my kind of restaurant.

Tonight my family and I had a FANTASTIC server!! David G was very attentive and gave us a great experience. We never had to ask for more napkins. He even remembered our drink order and brought them before we had to ask.

This is by far the worst service I have ever experienced. It took 20 minutes to get a refill on a soda and it was the wrong one. Then my burger was made with no pineapple and they returned it to me not cooked at all. The server had no idea how to be attentive to her tables. I noticed we weren't the only table she was neglecting. Unfortunately I have eaten here before plenty of times and had much better service. It was hands down the worst service I've experienced

Faster service if you sit in the bar area. Its located in a mall so it gets very busy during certain hours of the day. Food is good. Loud restaurant, not recommended for a quiet date night experience.

Let me start with saying I had high hopes for the place the moment I walked in. Then it all went downhill from there. We waited roughly 5 minutes at 10PM when there were only 4-5 other customers here, unacceptable especially given the fact that there were 3 employees just sitting down playing with their phones. We finally get seated my girlfriend orders a water as do I and thats when the claws come out, the waitress gives us a look and says "thats all you want to drink?" I simply ignore it assuming thats just how she is. So the reason we stopped by here is for a free birthday burger for I and the girlfriend ordered her own burger. I order the burger and the waitress comes back moments later saying I cant have that burger since its considered a "fine" burger. No where on the RR App does it mention of any restrictions. I speak to the manager who also has no power to do anything about it so I order a regular burger one "approved" for the free birthday burger meal. Same thing, now the computer wont allow it to be inputed. We finally get the burgers and I dont want to even eat it till I clarify if it will be free or not. The manager comes over says she was able to fix it somewhat I just simply thank her for her "help" and proceed to eating the burger which wasn't the best I ever had. The fries were cold at first but after we gave a few more complaints they came out piping hot. Overall I would say the service here definitely needs working on. The manager needs to retrain many of her employees who are immature and severely lack customer service skills.

Came in at 3:30 pm and got seated right away. The silverware was nasty and had to be replaced. The beverage menu was filthy. The men's restroom hadn't been cleaned in several hours. The food finally came and it was OK. Nothing special, I've had much better burgers elsewhere. All in all I think I will pass on this place in the future. 2.5 stars...

Went for dinner and we were seated in the bar.  Not sure why since there was plenty of room in the dining room.  The food was good but the service was extremely slow and it wasn't that busy in the bar.  Next time I will make sure we sit in the dining room.

The worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant!!  No exaggeration. We waited for 20 minutes for water because our server was never assigned. The food took over 30 minutes tocarrive and the messed up orders and forgot to fullfill one of my friend's orders.  It would take forever for our server to come back after we would request something. No refills or second order of fries.  Ordering milkshakes was probably the hardest  task ever at a restaurant. The staff messed up the order by bring wrong milkshakes. Then second time they brought one less than we ordered. The third time they brought the wrong type of milkshake so we finally gave up.  Lastly they messed up our bills. After 2 plus hours we had finsihed eating lunch.  The staff needs severe help in service! Red Robin is a fan favorite but this location was a termendous let down and ruined plans for the rest of the day.

Came here for a quick lunch and it wasn't bad at all... the bacon burger was decent (unfortunately a bit overcooked) and the fries are always good.  It's also nice that they will keep bringing you more fries as long as you keep asking for them.  The service was good... our waitress was very friendly and good on keeping drinks topped up.  Unfortunately, I've found the service here a bit inconsistent... we lucked out this time, but other times I've been, it has been pretty awful.  Otherwise, the burgers and fries are good enough to keep me coming back.

Have been sitting here for an hour now waiting for our food. Our waitress rarely stops by. We have 2 small children and a baby with us as well. We will not bring them here again if we have to wait this long. They don't have the patience nor do we to wait for food this long. We waited 30 minutes for our appetizer and she never brought us ranch dressing or silverware until we had finished our appetizer. One of the longest and most ridiculous waits for a burger we have ever sat through.

For my friends bday, we decided to go here last night to eat...BIG MISTAKE! Drinks were prompt, everything else was NOT! We waited an HOUR to receive our food.. mean while everyone around us got theirs BEFORE us, but came in AFTER us!! A  few ladies at a table next to us, even noticed and made a remark. Our waitress notified us that our meals were behind because they had to "remake" my chicken wings...ok I thought...we waited some more..sipped on our drinks...Out came our food..from the manager himself.. My remade chicken was COMPLETELY COLD! From The chips they laid on to the actual inside of the little chicken nuggets themselves! My friends burgers..cold as well..the cheese was hard and the bacon was crumbled and old. After complaining, they remade burgers, I no longer had the time or wanted to wait for My buffalo nuggets. :( bummer..I looked forward to that all day at work to be disappointed. Our waitress...sweet girl..she gave me some french fries to snack on. Yummy. The manager ended up giving food for free... Thanks. Will I go here again? I would like to..i just feel the place needs either more staff on ESP during the Holidays when the Mall is busy. ..and perhaps some better training for the cooks.

This restaurant is getting three stars for food quality, not service quality. Our waitress Jennifer was only prompt in giving our ticket. Our order was taken and we waited a very long time. Unfortunately, the table that came in 10 minutes afterwards got their food first ( and we had salads)!  My hubby talked to the manager, but I felt my fellow yelp people would like to know. It's a 50/50 for customer service!

location: Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton, CA
review: Horrible honestly. The host "forever" told us it was going to take 25min but it took 45mins. Forever took forever and started moving young high school on top of the list until the manager got there and supervised. Finally we got our table the waiter was a good guy he is honestly the only reason why I put two stars. His name is Bryce. He was trying his hardest but really it was just horrible. We waited 54 minutes for our food. I had a table for 5 and everyone food was like they had it under the lamp for quite some time. Once I took the first bite I was not satisfied and I ordered for the manager. She had to take my burger back and actually watch the workers in the back. Very disappointing knowing that I had to send the manager back to the cooks to make sure it was right and on top of it all she didn't even give me the my burger how I wanted it. I really did have a disappointing time and sadly it wS my first time going to Red Robins. Never again will I ate at RED ROBINS!!!!!!
Join the Red Robin Club for free burgers!!! This place can't go wrong!!

Its unfortunate because I like the fish. It's great. But the smell in the bar area is very offensive. To the point where I just nibble on my food. It smells dirty, old, like a foot is at best I can describe it. It needs a good scrub down or to change the carpet. I won't be back til it's cleared up.

I ordered a red tavern double(with a gardenburger) and my husband ordered a salad(yah I know..should've been the other way around). My burger was juicy, flavored well, and deliciously made, which is a huge task when working with a gardenburger. The fries were salted just right and were bottomless. My husband enjoyed his salad. It has walnuts, apples, Dijon flavored mustard, and mixed greens. He really loved it, and he's not too fond of salads. I ordered the margarita, which was only five bucks and it was perfectly made. The server, Mark, was attentive and really nice. He was waiting on quite a few tables and yet was able to check in with us frequently to make sure we had what we needed. If I was his boss I would definitely give him a raise. I highly recommend this location and will definitely be coming back. Parking is also right in front and there is always spaces available since it is a good size. Come here if you want a juicy burger and good fries.
Service was lousy.  Flat sodas and repeated requests for condiments.  Burgers were nothing special.  Service perked up considerably when it came time to pay the bill.  A one and done. Burger Hunter

Service here was terrible. Our party of four sat in the adult only bar area. The guy that seated us was great, but the waitress was terrible. It wasn't busy but she was never around. Our drinks never got refilled. We won't be back.

It's hard to be gluten free and go out to eat. Red robin is amazing about this! with their own gluten free menu, gluten free buns, and even a fry dedicated just for gluten free French fries. service was average, but definitely coming back again!

This is a Red Robin corporate owned restaurant, not a franchise.  It should be noted that our server was fast and friendly.  The basic menu items we ordered had no issues, but where this place fell on its face was the new dessert menu which included cheesecake.  The corporate office didn't bother to train the kitchen staff that when you take a commissary-prepared cheesecake out of the freezer you need to THAW IT BEFORE SERVING.  It was so frozen my steak knife wouldn't cut it and I could have used it to wedge the front door ajar.  The house did take it off my bill however this location needs to work on the staff training in a big way.

Been going to red robin for 20 years sitting in bar area with no wait... all of a sudden its not allowed and we were rudely told we have to wait to be seated... neadless to say we left and wont be returning

It's four stars because my family go here on a semi usual basis. They have an easy time accommodating my wife's gluten allergies with out it being too expensive of a place to go. The burgers are usually good and the service is quick and friendly. It's a chain so if you've been to one you know what to expect.

This was my first time eating at a Red Robins, we came here for lunch, I had the steak sliders and they were delicious! My fiance had the Bacon burger and he loved it. I'd be happy to come back for more anytime soon.  I don't think I've eaten any burgers that were actually this good before. But then I haven't eaten much burgers anyways.  For lunch service, I believe our waitress did a wonderful job. They had a little game you can play with your coaster while you wait for your food, I thought that was a great idea. Especially for enteratining customers and kids.

I'm not a huge fan of the chain restaurant.  In fact, I avoid them as much as possible.  But I'm down for Red Robin anytime.  I discovered Red Robin for the first time several months ago when I relocated to the Central Valley.  I'm glad I gave it a chance because I was blown away by how great the food is.  I've always had extraordinary service and my food has always been excellent.  My favorite are the salads and burgers.  It does have ridiculously tacky crap on the walls and even a silly frequent diners club, I caved and joined last month.  If you don't feel like eating there you can get it to go. Call ahead 20 minutes and you won't have to wait.

Would love this place if I didn't get a rude bartender Everytime I go in. She asks "what are you drinking". Doesn't ask how we're doing or anything just what are you drinking as if she is annoyed that she has customers. She never gets my order right. She never writes it down she just asks us what we want as if she's going to remember and when I get my meal it's always wrong. We can never seem to get frequent service to ask for more fries or refills. It's just a disaster. They need a new bartender.

great friendly staff, prompt service and great quality food. fair pricing and fun atmosphere. always a favorite any day of the week. I'm a fan of the entire menu, makes a great place for meeting with family friends and buisness.

I'm a big Red Robin fan. I have never gotten anything I didn't like there, and I've always had awesome service - until today. After being seated, my mom and I were promptly served our drinks, which I always appreciate. They took our order right away and then the staff basically disappeared. AN HOUR LATER (yes, an hour), we finally got our food...and my order was wrong. I ordered sweet potato fries and they brought regular steak fries. So I ate those and started to eat my burger while waiting for them to bring the right fries. The burger was not at all warm and had very little flavor. And considering that it was the Burnin' Love burger, that's kind of insane. How can there be no flavor in a burger with pepper jack cheese, fried jalapeños, chipotle aioli, and salsa?? I've had it numerous times before at other Red Robin locations and it was fantastic. My mom's salad sucked. The chicken was dry, there were a measly TWO fried jalapeño coins, and there was about one teaspoon of dressing in one small spot of the plate. We never received an apology or an explanation for the terribly slow service. The place wasn't even busy. It was like 30% full. We were charged full price for everything, even after the ridiculous wait and the crappy food. If you're at the Visalia Mall, you're better off eating in the food court.
In general, I like Red Robin, but the service here is hit or miss. Sometimes, the server is absolutely amazing but other times it sucks so bad we just walk out.

This place is awesome!!! Their club on foccacia, with a cup of clam chowder and a tall coors light, simply divine!!  This is a laid back restaurant that is always loaded with customers for lunch or dinner and is located conveniently in the Visalia Mall so you can shop and eat! The bar is small but has a few t.v.'s and is a very comfortable atmosphere!  I would always come here with my family whenever I visited the hometown! The burgers are really juicy and big and always come with endless amounts of steak fries!! Definitely recommend Red Robins!

We specifically searched for this place in Visalia because of my friends' certain dietary restrictions. So first of all, it's located in a mall. There's plenty of parking. It was pretty cracking for a Monday afternoon. We were seated right away in a booth. Drink orders were taken and they all were delivered at separate times, which I found weird. I got the freckled lemonade, as usual. My favorite part is the strawberries at the bottom. The first drink had an average amount and then they started to skimp on the refill. Grrr. I did like how our waitress didn't need to really ask us if we wanted refills on our drinks, she just brought them for us. Other than that service was a bit on the slow side. But I attribute that to it being so busy. It took awhile for our orders to be taken and then for our food to arrive and the check to be delivered. I got the prime chophouse burger, which is a special they're running right now. It had mushrooms, cheese and those stringy onion rings. So yummy. And of course it came with their bottomless fries. Sprinkle some of their special seasoning on those giant steak fries and it's on. :-) My friends had the turkey burger and veggie burger. Those were devoured quickly so that must mean they were delicious. Definitely one of my favorite chain places.

I was impressed with their food selection and their burgers were great! we had a large group of people dining there and we all had something different from pasta to burgers and every single thing we had was way above average!  I must say though, that the waiter we had was abysmal, but the food MORE than made up for it!  It was extremely loud in there but it is not "too" loud.  Their bottomless basket of fries are the way to go when eating at one fo the stools in the bar area too...

The waitress was so flighty, she messed up the order. We got our food 20 minutes later than the other people at our table. The food ended up being rather good. The clucks and fries and fish and chips had good flavor. The bathrooms were kept quite clean. Over all "meh" experience.
